greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the generalized Glaisher-Kinkelin constant A(3).
comment: Also known as the third Bendersky constant.
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge University Press, 2003, Section 2.15 Glaisher-Kinkelin constant, p. 137.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: A(k) = exp(B(k+1)/(k+1)*H(k) - zeta'(-k)), where B(k) is the k-th Bernoulli number and H(k) the k-th harmonic number.
Equals exp(3*Zeta'(4)/(4*Pi^4) - gamma/120) / (2*Pi)^(1/120), where gamma is the Euler-Mascheroni constant A001620. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jul 24 2015
mathematica: RealDigits[Exp[(BernoulliB[4]/4) * (EulerGamma + Log[2 * Pi] - (Zeta'[4]/Zeta[4]))], 10, 100] // First (* _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 31 2015 *)
results.author: _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 02 2014
